question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the smallest value of $x$ such that $|5x - 1| = |3x + 2|$? Express your answer as a common fraction.
inference:
$$\begin{split}5x - 1 &= \pm(3x + 2) \\\ 5x - 1 &= 3x + 2 \\\ 5x - 3x &= 2 + 1 \\\ 2x &= 3 \\\ x &= \frac{3}{2} \end{split}$$

or

$$\begin{split}5x - 1 &= -(3x + 2) \\\ 5x - 1 &= -3x - 2 \\\ 5x + 3x &= -2 + 1 \\\ 8x &= -1 \\\ x &= -\frac{1}{8} \end{split}$$

The smallest of these two values is $-\frac{1}{8}$, so the answer is

$$\text{Final Answer: }\boxed{-\frac{1}{8}}. \text{ I hope it is correct.}$$
ground_truth: There are two cases, when $5x-1=3x+2$ and when $5x-1=-(3x+2).$ The two equations yield $x=\frac{3}{2}$ and $x=-\frac{1}{8},$ respectively, of which $x=\boxed{-\frac{1}{8}}$ is the smaller solution.
